Name:
Emanuele Filiberto Duca d'Aosta

Z15
Stalingrad
Kerch
Namesake: Prince Emanuele Filiberto, Duke of Aosta
Fate:
Ceded to the Soviet Union as war reparation, March 1949
Scrapped, early 1960s
Displacement:
8,450 t (8,317 long tons) standard
10,539 t (10,373 long tons) full load
Propulsion:
2 shaft Belluzzo/Parsons geared turbines
6 Yarrow boilers
110,000 hp (82,027 kW)
Range: 3,900 nmi (7,200 km) at 14 knots (26 km/h; 16 mph)
Armament:
8 × 152 mm (6 in)/53 OTO Model 1929 naval guns (4×2)
6 × 100 mm (4 in)/47 OTO Model 1928 naval guns (3×2)
8 × 37 mm (1.5 in)/54 Breda Model 1932 AA cannons (4×2)
12 × 13.2 mm (0.52 in)/76 Breda Model 1931 AA machine guns (6×2)
6 × 21 in (533 mm) torpedo tubes (2×3)
Armour:
Deck: 35 mm (1.4 in)
Main belt: 70 mm (2.8 in)
Turrets: 90 mm (3.5 in)
Conning tower: 100 mm (3.9 in)
